definitions.definition: slight darkness caused by something blocking the direct light from the sun:
examples: The sun was hot, and there were no trees to offer us shade.

definitions.definition: a covering that is put over an electric light in order to make it less bright:
examples: The lamps all had matching purple shades.

definitions.definition: the parts of a picture or painting that the artist has made slightly darker than the other parts:
examples: A good artist can produce a very realistic effect using only light and shade.
She was wearing a black leather jacket and shades.

definitions.definition: a piece of material fixed onto a wooden or metal roller that can be pulled down to cover a window
to prevent direct light from shining on something:
examples: I shaded my eyes from the glare of the sun.
